  • Constructor Details

    • ParticleAnimator

      public ParticleAnimator(int animationSpeed)
      Parameters:
      animationSpeed - How often, in ticks, to render the particles.

    • ParticleAnimator

      public ParticleAnimator(int animationSpeed, int loops)
      Parameters:
      animationSpeed - How often, in ticks, to render the particles.
      loops - How many times to loop the animation, set to 0 for infinite.

  • Method Details

    • getAnimationSpeed

      public int getAnimationSpeed()
      Returns:
      How often, in ticks, this animator will render the particles.

    • getLoops

      public int getLoops()
      Returns:
      How many loops this animator will run before automatically stopping. If 0, the animator loops infinitely.

    • getParticle

      public ShapedParticle getParticle()
      Returns:
      The ShapedParticle that this Animator renders.

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
      Returns:
      If the animator is currently running.

    • setAnimationSpeed

      public ParticleAnimator setAnimationSpeed(int animationSpeed)
      Parameters:
      animationSpeed - Sets how often the animator will render the ShapedParticle in ticks.
      Returns:
      The ParticleAnimator instance

    • setLoops

      public ParticleAnimator setLoops(int loops)
      Parameters:
      loops - Sets the amount of times this animator will execute.
      Returns:
      The ParticleAnimator instance

    • start

      public void start(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, org.bukkit.Location location)
      Renders the attached ShapedParticle to a specific Player These particles will only be rendered to the provided Player. If you want to render the particles to all Players, use start(Location)
      Parameters:
      player - The Player to render the particles for
      location - The location to render the particles.

    • start

      public void start(org.bukkit.Location location)
      Renders the attached ShapedParticle to all Players If you want to render the particles to a specific Player, use start(Player, Location)
      Parameters:
      location - The location to render the particles.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Forcefully stop the Animator from rendering particles.

    • run

      public void run()
